content.body: Content-type parsing is nicely inconsistent in all the implementations.

content.body: And even wpt tests look buggy

content.body: Yoav Weiss: thanks for the review for sizes=auto! What do you think about the association concept? Storing a pointer on the attribute also feels weird because the attribute can be omitted. Storing it on the `` element still seems wrong because it could apply to multiple ``s e.g. ``. Maybe the parsed sizes result should be stored on the `img`?
content.formatted_body: Yoav Weiss: thanks for the review for sizes=auto! What do you think about the association concept? Storing a pointer on the attribute also feels weird because the attribute can be omitted. Storing it on the <source> element still seems wrong because it could apply to multiple <img>s e.g. <picture><source srcset='x 50w, y 100w' sizes=auto><img width=500><img width=1000></picture>. Maybe the parsed sizes result should be stored on the img?

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body: Yoav Weiss: thanks for the review for sizes=auto! What do you think about the association concept? Storing a pointer on the attribute also feels weird because the attribute can be omitted. Storing it on the `` element still seems wrong because it could apply to multiple ``s e.g. ``. Maybe the parsed sizes result should be stored on the `img`?

Yoav Weiss: thanks for the review for sizes=auto! What do you think about the association concept? Storing a pointer on the attribute also feels weird because the attribute can be omitted. Storing it on the <source> element still seems wrong because it could apply to multiple <img>s e.g. <picture><source srcset='x 50w, y 100w' sizes=auto><img width=500><img width=1000></picture>. Maybe the parsed sizes result should be stored on the img?

content.body: I'll ponder on it and come up with something tomorrow :)
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: I'll ponder on it and come up with something tomorrow :)
